title: Who all can benefit from the protections of the Domestic Violence Act,  2005?
content:
The beneficiaries of this Act include:-

 - All females who are or have been in a domestic relationship with the abuser

in a household through blood, marriage, adoption or any relationship in the

nature of the marriage.

 - It includes widows and children as well.

 - The Act also covers relationship with family members living together as the

joint family.

 - The term ‘relationship in the nature of marriage’ refers to those relationships

where there is no marriage between the parties, in the since of solemnization

of a marriage under any law. Yet the parties represent to the world that they

are a couple and there is stability and continuity in the relationship. Proof of

such relationship would be use of common name, common ration card,

address, commitment of parties to the shared household, existence of the

significant period of cohabitation, children born of the relationship etc.,

 - **Note: - The Act covers all women who may be mother, sister, wife and
widow, children under 18 years of age or partners living in the shared
household. The relationship may be in the nature of marriage, or
through a relationship in the nature of a marriage, adoption or are family
members living together as a joint family.**
